results.title: The Eureka Story
results.brief_description: A unique perspective on the Eureka Stockade story created by a Eureka 150 youth ambassador in a special Digital Storytelling Workshop to celebrate 150 years since the famous rebellion. Tom, a year 9 student from Ballarat, completed this story about the causes for the battle “…because it is the most interesting part”.

results.title: The Eternal forest
results.creator_credit: United States. Forest Service and U.S.A Department of Agriculture
results.brief_description: The story of North America’s primeval forests showing early neglect in the years of America’s growth and expansion, as opposed to today’s sensible balance between the use of forest resources and their protection for future generations

results.title: The Eternal forest
results.brief_description: Designed to explain the important part played by forests in paper manufacture. Photographed in the Boola-Boola area of Gippsland, Victoria, various operations are shown in which timber, removed for papermaking, is being replaced by seedling pines which will mature for use in future years. The film includes views of the residential area of Traralgon, the manufacturing processes at the Maryvale mill, and also lists various uses of paper products.

results.title: The Eternal fight
results.creator_credit: Victor Vicas, Michael Alexander, United Nations. Film Board and Madeleine Carroll Films
results.brief_description: Through history humans have fought an eternal struggle against plagues, hunger, and war. Scientists of many nations have contributed to this fight against disease. The developments of the 19th and 20th centuries havce created new health problems because of industrial employment, crowded cities and more rapid means of communication. Control of disease is only now possible on a world-wide basis. The film is a dramatised story of the work of the World Health Organisation organsied to fight disease on a global scale.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victor Vicas, Michael Alexander, United Nations. Film Board and Madeleine Carroll Films

results.title: The Esthetics of Disappearance
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
This work, which takes its title from Paul Virilio’s publication of the same name, explores notions of the cinematic in relation to recent global history, with particular focus on the role of the media in conveying information and events into the home via the medium of the television. Virilio’s thesis upon cinema and temporal experience proposed that ‘with the cinematic accelerator…the measure of the world becomes that of the vector of movement, of the means of locomotion that desynchronize time’. Notions of heightened speed and the distortion of perception are conveyed visually in the work by the rapidity of images and their intense colouration.
Notes by Rachel Kent, reprinted courtesy of the author and d/Lux Media Arts.

results.title: The Estate
results.creator_credit: Caswell Coggins, Mike Carr, Balletboyz, Crossfire and Channel 4
results.brief_description: A short dance piece set in an English housing estate. The choreography is loosely based on the idea of vultures circling a dying animal, feeling their excitement and anticipation as they gather to feed, waiting for the moment to strike.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Caswell Coggins, Mike Carr, Balletboyz, Crossfire and Channel 4

results.title: The Esso Australian Jazz Summit
results.brief_description: Sydney’s famous Bondi Beach came alive with a foot-tapping, head-nodding event, the First Australian Jazz Summit. All styles of jazz were represented, from modern, traditional through to avant-garde. Various ensembles and configurations of players performed, from standard groups to Big Bands, feature soloists and, of course, jam sessions and improvisation. Rated: G

results.title: The Esperance story
results.creator_credit: Michael Thornhill, Richard Mason, Western Australia. Dept. of Native Welfare and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Esperance, a small town on the southern coast of Western Australia, is a community centre for wealthy pastoralists and graziers. A smaller number of aborigines also live there, who are in the care of the Western Australian Department of Native Welfare. Two of the aborigines have been granted blocks of land to farm, which will enable them to bridge the social and economic gap, provided that the white community accepts them without prejudice or paternalism
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Thornhill, Richard Mason, Western Australia. Dept. of Native Welfare and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: The Eskimo: fight for life
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, Quentin Brown and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An authentic record of the life of the Netsilik Inuit of the Pelly Bay region of the Canadian Arctic during their last migratory camp. It shows the old Inuit culture, the communal life of the seal hunters and their families, their complete adaptation to the environment. This film was produced, with commentary from footage brought out of the Arctic by anthropologists. (Award: New York)

results.title: The Escort = La Scorta
results.creator_credit: Ricky Tognazzi, Claudio Bonivento and Claudio Bonivento Productions
results.brief_description: La Scorta is the rivetting story of a judge and the four carbinieri officers assigned to protect him and their attempts to fight corruption in Sicily. The film opens with the violent death of a judge and his escort. Judge Michele de Francesco (Carlo Cecchi) volunteers as his replacement and soon discovers that corruption has infiltrated all levels of the community. Soon he finds that the only people he can trust are the four men assigned as his bodyguards, Angelo Mandelosi (Claudio Amendola), Andrea Corsale (Enrico Lo Verso), Fabio Muzzi (Ricky Memphis) and Raffaele Frasca (Tony Sperandeo). The five men risk their lives and the safety of their families in order to fight corruption in the Sicilian town. Ricky Tognazzi directs a seat-gripping thriller which comments on corruption in modern Italian society. With a musical score by Ennio Morricone. In Italian with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ricky Tognazzi, Claudio Bonivento and Claudio Bonivento Productions
